intro: Lithocarpus dealbatus subsp. mannii, commonly known as the white-leaf tecton, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical forests, often reaching heights of up to 30 meters. Its leaves are leathery, glossy, and have a distinctive white underside, contributing to its common name.
